description: From French gazomètre, corresponding to gas +‎ -o- +‎ -meter.

entries.meaning: (chemistry, historical) An apparatus used to store or measure gas or the flow of gas, particularly in a laboratory setting. [from 18th c.]
A large tank or reservoir for storing gas; a gasholder. [from 19th c.]
examples: The attack on the gasworks was probably the most risky, as none of the rebels had any idea of just what kind of blast an exploding gasometer might produce  […]
